messages.message:
Hello,

I’m not able to login into my Crafting sandbox today. (Running master with `ppy`)
After I put my credentials and mfa it just brings me back to the logged out main page. I’d appreciate any help with how to troubleshoot it.
I did a resync and updated `"cache_host": "redis"` lets see if that helps

No, now I’m  getting
```Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/owner/instabase/webserver/webapp/build/py/instabase/cache/cache.py", line 517, in get
    return self._cache.get(key), None
  File "/home/owner/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/webapp-GFHcnopq-py3.9/lib/python3.9/site-packages/tenacity/__init__.py", line 329, in wrapped_f
    return self.call(f, *args, **kw)
  File "/home/owner/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/webapp-GFHcnopq-py3.9/lib/python3.9/site-packages/tenacity/__init__.py", line 409, in call
    do = self.iter(retry_state=retry_state)
  File "/home/owner/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/webapp-GFHcnopq-py3.9/lib/python3.9/site-packages/tenacity/__init__.py", line 369, in iter
    six.raise_from(retry_exc, fut.exception())
  File "<string>", line 3, in raise_from
tenacity.RetryError: RetryError[<Future at 0x7f2848131760 state=finished raised ConnectionError>]"
level=ERROR time=2024-11-19 16:52:38,607 msg="Could not GET key=login-email-attempts-slawek.biel@instabase.com from REDIS."  path="/home/owner/instabase/webserver/webapp/build/py/instabase/cache/cache.py:519" process="MainProcess" thread="ThreadPoolExecutor-0_1" trace_id="" exception="Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/owner/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/webapp-GFHcnopq-py3.9/lib/python3.9/site-packages/redis/connection.py", line 539, in connect
    sock = self._connect()
  File "/home/owner/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/webapp-GFHcnopq-py3.9/lib/python3.9/site-packages/redis/connection.py", line 596, in _connect
    raise err
  File "/home/owner/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/webapp-GFHcnopq-py3.9/lib/python3.9/site-packages/redis/connection.py", line 584, in _connect
    sock.connect(socket_address)
ConnectionRefusedError: [Errno 111] Connection refused```
@jordy.vlan is that the same thing you were dealing with?
